Description: Fragment of painted tomb-wall depicting part of the nemes of king Ramses IV. Part of a tomb scene showing Inherkhau and his wife worshipping a series of dead kings and queens; this fragment is from the seventh figure of the lower register.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Deir el-Medina (Thebes), Tomb of Inherkhau TT359 (after PM)
Curator's comments: From Chamber F, south wall. Published; J-P. Corteggiani and N. Cherpion, La tombe d'Inherkhaouy (TT 359) a Deir el-Medina (MIFAO128, 2010), 48-61, pl. 38
Additional IDs: Other BM number: EA5615 (original Big Number)
